title: Making choices riskier is only going to lengthen pro games.
body:
Why would you go in when you HAVE TO WIN THE TRADE. Just for context there is no, “if I play it just right I might win”. It’s literally “if I don’t kill them in 1 second I may have lost the game." 

It’s boring to watch, it’s boring to play. Ask yourself if you want to live your life knowing that one mistake means it’s over. NO YOU DO NOT. That’s why we mandate safety ratings. The safety rating of league is one mistake you are done. I saw a double kill minute 1 in a 5v5 the other day. The game was unwinnable. The whole team even agreed to FF at15.

IT WAS THE MOST BORING THING IVE SEEN. It was honestly worse than the S2 tank meta. ( which I enjoyed with its CONSTANT SKIRMISHES)

Fuck riot do you want your game to be played? Pretty soon we will be back to a farm meta because no one wants to risk that first blood ending the game at 5 minutes.

This post almost feels like I could have written it. I miss when there were clearly defined "outplays" and when you could have pride in the play you just made. 

Now I just feel like if I don't instantly kill the enemy adc/assassin I probably just lost the trade. I think the big change was the focus towards damage instead of having a nice balance between damage and tank.

Community kept crying for the removal of tanks, but really tanks are what kept the game in a happy role rotation. Now we are just in a rotation of whomever has the highest nuke.

Essentially that is what I was saying, yes. I wanted to keep my post open enough to interpretation so that more people would find it easy to agree with, without those people disagreeing with what I personally think of the game.

Yeah the whole reason LCS games are drawn out farmfests is because one bad play can mean the whole game. 

Sure the Azir _could_ go for that juicy 5 man Shurima shuffle into 5 man Gnar ult but if you fuck it up just know you're gonna lose mid outer turret, inner turret, inhibitor turret, inhibitor, Baron and probably a Dragon too.

It's probably why they made the baron buff changes, so LCS teams don't have to take risks to close-out a game. Just recently in the LCK SKT vs Jin-Air have been playing 1 hour and 30 mins matches. With harder pushing minions they won't have to step forward to procure inhibitors and towers and easily close out games.

Aside from that it stinks having the games balance revolve around pro players. They're much better at managing their turrets uptime, unlike lower ranked players.

But now, neither team will allow the other to get the baron buff. They'll try to punish anyone who tries to take baron, leading to the pros just tiptoeing around baron leading to longer games because the pros are getting more and more risk-averse. 

Idk why Riot can't foresee these things
